isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - ENGINE FAN CONTROL - FUNCTION

svcproc.title: FUNCTION
svcproc.para: The purpose of the Engine Fan Control is to provide the proper logic to determine when the Fan should be turned on or off by energizing/de-energizing the fan drive solenoid. The purpose of the engine fan is to allow a higher air flow for heat exchange between the radiator and the ambient air when needed. In addition, the engine fan may be used as a vehicle retarding device.
